Page Content: As a couple in our early thirties, we recently had the pleasure of visiting Bali for the first time and were absolutely blown away by the beauty and culture of this incredible island. From the stunning beaches to the lush rice terraces, there is no shortage of things to see and do in Bali, and we highly recommend it as a destination for couples looking for a romantic getaway. Here are our top five picks for things to do in Bali:  1. Visit the Tegalalang Rice Terraces: These terraced rice fields are located just north of Ubud and offer breathtaking views of the surrounding countryside. We spent a morning wandering through the terraces, taking in the sights and sounds of the local farmers at work. It was a peaceful and serene experience, and we highly recommend it for couples looking to escape the hustle and bustle of the city.  2. Take a cooking class: Balinese cuisine is known for its fresh ingredients and bold flavors, and we had a blast learning how to make some of our favorite dishes in a traditional Balinese cooking class. Our instructor was knowledgeable and friendly, and we left with a newfound appreciation for the art of Balinese cooking.  3. Relax on the beaches of Seminyak: Seminyak is known for its beautiful beaches, and we spent many lazy afternoons lounging on the sand and taking in the stunning views of the Indian Ocean.

As a couple in our early thirties, we recently visited Bali and had the most amazing time! We stayed in Seminyak and found it to be the perfect location for our trip. It was close to the beach, had plenty of restaurants and shops, and was a great base for exploring the rest of the island.  One of our favorite things to do in Bali was to explore the local markets. We visited the Ubud Market and the Sukawati Art Market, and we were blown away by the variety of goods on offer. From handmade crafts and clothing to fresh produce and spices, there was something for everyone. We loved haggling with the vendors and walking away with some unique souvenirs to remember our trip by.  Another must-visit attraction in Bali is the Tegalalang Rice Terrace. This stunning rice field is located in the north of Ubud and offers breathtaking views of the surrounding countryside. We recommend renting a scooter and driving up there early in the morning to avoid the crowds and enjoy the peaceful atmosphere. It's the perfect place to take some photos and soak up the beauty of the island.  If you're looking for a romantic activity to do with your partner, we highly recommend taking a sunset dinner cruise. We booked a cruise with Bali Hai Cruises and had an amazing time. The boat was beautiful, the food was delicious, and the views of the sunset over the ocean were absolutely stunning.

I'm a 30-year-old who loves to travel with my pets. I recently visited Bali, Indonesia, and I'm excited to share some of the best pet-friendly attractions and activities I found during my trip.  First on my list is the Bali Animal Welfare Association (BAWA). This non-profit organization is dedicated to rescuing and rehabilitating animals in need. They have a shelter in Ubud where you can visit and play with the animals, and they also offer volunteer opportunities if you're interested in getting more involved. My pets had a great time playing with the other animals, and it was a great way to support a good cause.  Next up is the Bali Bird Park. This park is home to over 1,000 birds from 250 different species, and they welcome pets on leashes. The park is beautifully landscaped, and there are plenty of shaded areas to rest in. My pets loved watching the birds fly around and listening to their songs.  Another great option for pet owners is the Bali Safari and Marine Park. This park has a petting zoo where you can interact with goats, rabbits, and other small animals. They also have a petting pool where you can swim with the park's resident stingrays. My pets had a blast playing with the other animals and getting up close and personal with the stingrays.  Finally, I recommend checking out the Jimbaran Bay Beach.

Relax on the beaches of Seminyak: Seminyak is known for its beautiful beaches, and we spent many lazy afternoons lounging on the sand and taking in the stunning views of the Indian Ocean. The beaches here are perfect for couples looking to relax and unwind, and there are plenty of beachside cafes and bars to keep you entertained.  4. Explore the Ubud Monkey Forest: This lush forest is home to hundreds of monkeys, and we had a blast watching them play and interact with each other. The forest is also home to several ancient temples, which are well worth exploring. Just be sure to keep a close eye on your belongings, as the monkeys are known to be mischievous!  5. Go on a sunrise hike up Mount Batur: This was definitely the highlight of our trip. We woke up at 2 am to make the trek up the volcano, and were rewarded with stunning views of the sunrise over the surrounding countryside. The hike itself is not too difficult, but it can be a bit challenging in the dark, so be sure to bring a headlamp and wear sturdy shoes.  Overall, we had an amazing time in Bali and would highly recommend it as a destination for couples looking for a romantic getaway. There is so much to see and do on this beautiful island, and we can't wait to go back and explore more of what it has to offer.

As a 70-year-old retiree, I recently had the pleasure of visiting Paris for the first time. It was a trip I had been looking forward to for years, and I was not disappointed. Here are some of my favorite attractions and activities that I would recommend to other seniors visiting the city.  First on my list is the Eiffel Tower. This iconic landmark is a must-see for anyone visiting Paris, and the views from the top are truly breathtaking. While there are stairs to the second level, I opted for the elevator, which was a bit pricier but much more comfortable for someone of my age. I recommend booking tickets in advance to avoid long lines.  Next up is the Louvre Museum. This museum is massive, so I recommend picking a few galleries that interest you and focusing on those. I spent most of my time in the Egyptian and Greek galleries, which were absolutely fascinating. The museum also offers guided tours and audio guides, which can be helpful for navigating the vast collection.  Another highlight of my trip was a visit to the Palace of Versailles. This grand palace is located just outside of Paris and is easily accessible by train. I recommend taking a guided tour to learn more about the history of the palace and its famous residents, including King Louis XIV. The gardens are also worth exploring, with beautiful fountains and sculptures.  For a more relaxed activity, I suggest taking a stroll along the Seine River.

I am 45 years old and I am a pet owner. I recently visited Paris with my pet and I wanted to share some of the popular tourist attractions and fun things to do in Paris for traveling with pets.  First, I would suggest visiting the Jardin des Tuileries. This beautiful park is located between the Louvre Museum and the Place de la Concorde and is a great place to take a leisurely stroll with your pet. The park has plenty of green space for your pet to run around and play, and there are also several fountains and sculptures to explore. The park is also home to a petanque court, which is a popular French game that is similar to bocce ball.  Another popular tourist attraction that is pet-friendly is the Champ de Mars. This large public park is located near the Eiffel Tower and is a great place to take a picnic with your pet. The park has plenty of grassy areas for your pet to run around and play, and there are also several benches and tables where you can sit and enjoy a meal. The park is also home to several food vendors, so you can grab a bite to eat while you relax with your pet.  If you are looking for something a little more active, I would suggest visiting the Bois de Boulogne. This large park is located on the western edge of Paris and is a great place to go for a walk or a bike ride with your pet.
